volume.name: Beneath the Planet of the Apes

description:
Step right up, folks and pay attention! This is it! At long last, Bettie Page has given her blessing to this, her very first officially licensed comic book. And the man who's put it all together in this stunningly illustrated package: Dave Stevens, of course (need you ask?). Featuring three complete stories, Bettie's exploits take her from camera club misadventures to B-movie making, to meeting little green men in Central Park! 
 
Pg. 1: "Jumpin' Jungle Jive" 
pg. 11: "Sandbar Skirmish" 
pg. 17: "Cartoon on Bettie Page" 
pg. 19: "Mars Wants Bettie"
name: Bettie Page Comics

description: Whoops! This time, Bettie is the one falling in love. She runs smack into the Roman general, Julius Caesar, and is overcome by his animal magnetism. But there's a problem: Cleopatra has a serious "thing" for Caesar. And he can't decide between the two of them. So the two nubile lovelies battle it out to become "The Queen of the Nile"!
name: Mad Love

volume.name: Bettie Page: Queen of the Nile

Skyman

3. Food Shortage

6. Heroes Are Born

Spy-Master

name: Big Shot Comics

description:
Sweet Dreams of Death

  Alonzo Bates dreams of making it big and builds a huge Roman palace to play in. Patrolman Kip Burland chases a crook into the palace, and now Alonzo wants a payoff for keeping the crook's whereabouts silent — it's either pay-up or get evicted (shot). Soon the Black Hood enters Alonzo's place to find several hidden thugs, and becomes part of Alonzo's gladiator games.
name: Sweet Dreams of Death

description:
Features Include:

Riddle Of The Third Face!
The Isle of Doom!
Spotlight on Murder!
The Walls Have Ears
Mystery of the Rajah's Ruby!
name: Riddle Of The Third Face!

description:
In this issue:

"CUDA: Heart of Darkness" by Tim Vigil, Tim Tyler and Kimberley Richardson

"The Crow: Inertia" by James O'Barr

"Street Shadows: True Love" by Kyle Garrett, Mark Bloodworth and Vince Locke

"Thrill-Kill" by Mark Winfrey and Daniel Roy McKinnon

"Nightstreets: A Preview" by Mark Bloodworth and Randy Zimmerman

"IO" by Barbed Wire Halo Studios

This issue features the first appearance of James O'Barr's The Crow and Tim Vigil's Cuda.

The return of Jason Pearson's Body Bags! Aliens by Beau Smith and Gray Morrow! A collaboration between Madman's Mike Allred and Land of Nod's Jay Stephens! The world's first comic strip by Penn Jillette, of the comedy duo Penn & Teller! All this plus the amazing talent of Mark Verheiden, Chris Marrinan, Andrew Pepoy, Renée French, John Arcudi, Scott Musgrove, and Paul Pope! It'll keep you up at night and caffeinate you in the morning!
name: Body Bags

Features Include:

2. The Zeppelin Attack Featuring K-4 and his Sky Devils

3. On the Trail of Muro Featuring Monako

Horror in Hollywood!
The "Dude"

Notes:

  • Linear Man, Saturn Girl, Lightning Lad, Cosmic Boy, Mr. Z, Franklin D. Roosevelt, a dinosaur, Merlin, Dev-Em and Gangbuster cameo flashback appearances.

Features Include:

1. The Jelly Of Doom Featuring Fiery Mask

2. The Devil-Flower Featuring Trojak the Tiger-Man

3. Strike Against the Nazis Featuring K-4 and His Sky Devils

4. The Origin of Monako Featuring Monako

5. Battle of the Robots Featuring Marvex the Super Robot

6. Planet of the Black Light Featuring Whirlwind Carter

7. The Death Clutch

8. Rebuilding the World Featuring Breeze Barton

9. Introducing Little Hercules Featuring Little Hercules

10. Meet the Falcon Featuring The Falcon
name: The Jelly Of Doom

description:
The Eradicator faces the final purge of his home planet, leaving the universe with one true Last Son of Krypton!

Superman discovers that the Eradicator is miraculously still alive. He and a team of scientists do what they can to ensure his survival.

Notes:

  • Cover sketched by Ed Hannigan, penciled by Kerry Gammill, inked by Jackson Guice and colored by Susanne Bourdages.
  • Cameo flashback appearances of the Eradicator's other forms.
  • While at S.T.A.R. Labs, Doctor David Conner hears a report on the news that the Outsiders are wanted for the mass murder in Markovia.
  • Doctor David Conner becomes the Eradicator.
  • "DC Universe 14" one page text piece featuring "Who is Your Favorite Bloodlines Hero?," "Punishing Elements" featuring Metamorpho puns and "DC Bullets" featuring new babies in the DC family, editors promotions and Bloodlines notes. Metamorpho artwork by Graham Nolan.
  • Triangle 1993 #36.
  • Chronological continuation from Adventures of Superman #506.
  • Chronological continuation in Superman: The Man of Steel #28.
name: The Last Purge of Krypton!

5. Scales of Justice

6.The Schustak Case Featuring The Falcon

9.The Coming of Tigerman Featuring Tigerman

  4. "Fire!" (Flip & Dip)
  5. "Turtle Soup" (Barney Bear & Benny Burro / written and drawn by Carl Barks)

  7. "Glasses" (Tom and Jerry : on back cover)

1. Superman's Super-Self! (Superman vs Lex Luthor's giant statue of Superman) -- 2. Case of the Crooked Champs! (Green Arrow & Speedy) -- 3. School For Acrobats (Boy Commandos) -- 4. Postage Stamp Plunder (Zatara) -- 5. Each One Teach One (Johnny Everyman) -- 6. Crime Under Glass (Batman & Robin vs The Glass Man).

On cover: $100 cash to anybody who can stay in the ring 2 minutes with One Round Riley.

1. Cover by Curt Swan and Stan Kaye. The Leopard Girl of the Jungle! (Lois Lane, Superman & Lana Lang) -- 2. Honey in Hollywood (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 3. The Tricks of Lois Lane! (with Superman) -- 4. Little Pocahontas (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 5. Lois Lane's Super-Perfume! written by Unknown, penciled and inked by Kurt Schaffenberger. (with Superman)

"It's Incredible! Lois Lane Has Given Up the Outside World to Lead a Leopard Pack"--Superman's thought bubble on cover.
name: The Leopard Girl of the Jungle!

description:
Flash is doing a weird excersice, he's trying to run at a speed that will enable him to see the electromagnetic waves by tuning onto their frequencies. Superman tells him to be careful.

Later, while the other members of the Justice League are out in the Javelin, Flash recieves a message that some inexplicable is happening to the machines at S.T.A.R. Labs. Flash puts his idea to test. He attempts to zip to earth as an electromagnetic wave through telephone signal carrier, but dials the fax number instead. When he emerges at S.T.A.R. Labs, he's 2-D and flat. He spots some aliens who like himself are 2-D and are damaging the machines. He starts busting them.

The other members cannot see the creatures and call the Justice League for help. They arrive only to find Flash tearing up the whole laboratory. They capture Flash and take him back to the WatchTower to revert him to his original dimensions.

Hawkgirl and Martian Manhunter come back to S.T.A.R. Labs and find traces of alien bio-plasmic energy. They go back to the watchtower and make a report. Flash tells them that the aliens are already inside the Watchtower. GL uses depolarised light to reveal the aliens.

A battle takes place with the aliens easily overpowered. They try to escape but Flash resets their equipments so that they go into a 1-D universe. He is then reverted back to his original form.
name: Flash Fax

description:
A bunch of mini-mysteries for the Scooby Gang (and us) to solve. See the gang take on aliens, ghosts, swamp creatures, more ghosts, a Frankenstein type monster and his friend, a red hairy thing.

Plus Velma educates us on Monsters of the world, including facts about werewolves and Medusa.

Also included are the solutions to a couple of the mysteries so you can see if you have what it takes to be part of Mystery, Inc.
name: Scooby's Mini-Mysteries: Fly By Night; Ghosts in the Mystery Machine; A Well-Laid Trap; Time To Scare; Monster Mix-Up; Velma's Monsters of the World: Werewolves, Medusa; Solution Page for Fly By Night & Time To Scare

description:
1. Introduction (by Tom Rauffenbart, David's lover)
  2. Seven Miles A Second (started by David Wojnarowicz, finished by James Romberger)
  3. 3. Afterword: Portrait Of The Artist As A Young Maniac (by Carlo McCormick)

When the League learns that there’s a giant creature using the moon as a giant monster incubator, they do everything in their power to keep things stable. But as the gargantuan beast starts to hatch, the very Earth itself is threatened with certain doom! And when a stormy old foe uses the opportunity to create chaos, the Justice League finds themselves buffeted by the howling winds of fate!
name: New Moon!

description: Game on! Hercules has picked up the gauntlet thrown down by King Eurytheses and then some ­ he's completed eight of the Twelve Labors set before him. Now comes the hardest part: Four final four challenges that could very well push the Prince of Power over the brink. Zounds! What a conclusion!
name: The New Labors of Hercules, Part 5

description: The comic based on the hot Cartoon Network show continues with “Stepping Out,” the troubling tale of a super-hero’s dilemma: balancing a love life with his duties to the JLA. When evil strikes, it’s never convenient--and the Flash somehow must help the Justice League save the world without raising the ire of his beautiful date.
name: Stepping Out

description:
1. Cover by John Byrne.
  2. "All that Glisters" written, penciled and inked (Figure Inks) by John Byrne, inked (Background Inks) by Keith Williams, colored by Tom Ziuko and lettered by John Costanza. Booster Gold launches a crusade against Superman on Superman Day, leading to a fight between the two heroes.

Notes:

  • The Sprang Building is a homage to artist Dick Sprang.
  • Story continues in Booster Gold #23.
  • The cover is a homage to Booster Gold #7.

Spoilers

Gotham City. Just before midnight Batman, Robin and Superman meet on the roof of the old Sprang Building. Superman needs Batman's detective help. He hands him a scrap book but gives him no information about it and asks if Batman if he can find anything unusual. Batman says he'll meet back with Superman in three days. All Robin can say is “wow!” It is the first time he has met Superman. Eventually he gets enough courage to ask Superman for his autograph. Superman cuts a piece of edging material from the roof with his heat vision and carves best to Robin from Superman with his fingernail. Just before he leaves Batman congratulates him about Superman Day in Metropolis the next day.

That morning in Metropolis Trixie Collins a.k.a. Goldstar is walking down the street thinking about being a superhero and about Booster as she sees a poster that says “Booster Gold says we need another hero!!” It also has the Superman's symbol in a circle with a line crossing it out. She is shocked and just as she turns around she sees Booster fly by. She calls out to him but he seemingly ignores her. He flies over to a large covered statue of Superman that was to be revealed at the Superman Day festivities. He pulls off the cover off and blasts the statue to pieces.

At the Daily Planet Perry White tells Lois Lane that she has to go to the Booster Gold's press conference, and she is ticked about it. When she goes a much angrier Booster tells the press that Superman is guilty of “crimes against humanity” for his actions in Quarc. Lois tries to stand up too him but Booster holds his own and even makes her look bad.

In Mayor Frank Berkowitz office they are talking about Superman Day and how good it will be for his administration. Shortly after, his daughter Julianna walks in and a few minutes later so does Booster. Booster barges in talks smack about Superman, starts blasting and kidnaps Julianna. He takes her to a roof top and starts to cause her pain so she'll call for help and lure Superman to him.

At the Superman Day festivities or Superday, Superman is giving a speech when he hears the call for help. He quickly leaves and shows up in time to fight Booster. Unfortunately Booster kicks the tar out of him.

At the Daily Planet Lois hears the news quickly grabs a photographer named Gus and goes to the scene. She arrives in time to see a beaten Superman in Booster's fist. Then when you think it's all over a second Booster Gold shows up. What a cliff hanger!
name: All that Glisters

description:
After a series of unsuccessful battles with Spider-Man, Norman Osborn, Dr. Octopus, Electro and the Sandman have been incarcerated together in a prison-wing of the S.H.I.E.L.D. Triskelion. Charged with illegally tampering with their genetic structure, Nick Fury claims that they're there at his pleasure, de-powered and with no hope of release. There is, however, hope of rehabilitation if they choose to co-operate with S.H.I.E.L.D. 
 
Elsewhere in the city, Kraven the Hunter has returned. In a televised interview, he offers viewers the chance to see him hunt down Spider-Man and this time the outcome will be in his favor. But what of the rumors of a "new and improved" Kraven? Will this bring him to the attention of The Ultimates?
name: Chapter 1

description: Ben Templesmith returns with his first solo project since Singularity 7. Meet Wormwood, the English-accented, beer-drinking, sentient corpse possessing a maggot expat from the Hell dimension. Well, one of them. If he's not attempting to save Earth from demonic, parasitic fungal infections or undead strippers, then he's off drinking with his homemade mechanical sidekick, Mr. Pendulum. Collecting one of the original short stories first seen in Lo-Fi Magazine, this book also includes extra pages, new artwork and background material. It's a perfect prelude to the upcoming, all-new Wormwood regular series coming from IDW Publishing, written and drawn by the artist responsible for 30 Days of Night, Singularity 7, and Fell.
name: Leroy's Special Brew

description:
1. Rugoth, God of Greed

2. Glittar, City of Boredon and Bankrolls

3. Chop Chop

4. The Storm King is Trapped

5. Mr. Powder
name: Rugoth, God of Greed

description:
By order of Police Commissioner Gordon, Michael Dubcek, a former stooge of the Joker's, is left to rot in solitary confinement, at Sparta Prison. Gordon hopes that sweating it out in solitary will eventually loosen Dubcek's tongue, regarding the Joker's criminal operations. After a week, Dubcek is close to cracking. Fearing that Dubcek may talk, the Joker makes plans to silence his former henchman. At Hillman's Gym, ex- heavy weight champion of the world, Ted Grant, trains for an exhibition match at Sparta Prison. Grant takes on a retired bantamweight fighter, Whitey Ross, as his ringside assistant. Against Gordon's wishes, the warden of Sparta Prison releases Dubcek from solitary, to face Grant in the ring. A simple exhibition fight becomes a brutal grudge match, but by the fourth round, Grant lays out Dubcek on the canvas. Two days later, every inmate at Sparta Prison is suffering from a rare tropical fever. When it's revealed that Dubcek was the first man to come down with the disease, the warden confesses to releasing Dubcek from solitary to box Grant, then allowing him to dine with the other inmates after the match. The infection is traced to Dubcek's water bucket, which had been switched by Grant's man, Ross. In truth, Ross was really the Joker's man. To silence Dubcek, the Joker has imperiled the lives of over 600 convicts.

Fortunately, a lone scientist, at the Barston Institute, has been researching the rare disease inflicted upon Sparta Prison's inmates. This scientist has one laboratory animal, a dog called "Spot", whose blood is teeming with enough antibodies to cure the prison populace. Batman and Wildcat provide an escort for the armored car carrying the invaluable canine to the airport. Thanks to a wiretap on Gordon's personal line, the Joker has been tipped off to his enemies plans. Driving ahead of the armored car, the Joker releases his deadly laughing gas through his vehicle's exhaust. The armored car begins weaving wildly into traffic, before crashing into a pylon. With the guards incapacitated by the Joker's gas, the Clown Prince of Crime takes possession of Spot. Wildcat takes off in pursuit of the Joker's car. Spot leaps out the window to chase another dog. Wildcat breaks off his pursuit of the Joker, to trail Spot. The chase takes Wildcat across an opening drawbridge. The two dogs leap onto a passing barge, while Wildcat is forced to vault the bridge. Wildcat, Batman, the Joker, and Gotham City's police are all on the hunt for Spot. After being put off the barge, Spot ends up with a young boy, who spends several hours playing with the dog. Spotted by the Batman, the boy runs away, as does Spot. Spot is next found by a vagrant who sees the dog as his ticket to the big time. Ultimately, Spot is picked up by local dogcatchers. At the dog pound, Spot is claimed by the Joker.

Breaking into the Batman's secret police frequency, the Joker instructs Batman and Wildcat to come to Jefferson Square Garden, if they ever want to see Spot alive again. Holding a gun to the dog's head, the Joker forces Batman and Wildcat to fight for his entertainment. The two heroes are fitted with spiked Roman cestus gloves, to ensure a particularly bloody match. Batman and Wildcat brutally lay into one another, trading bone crushing blows with each other. The punishing battle goes on for several moments, until a final haymaker from each combatant drops them both to the mat. With Batman and Wildcat reeling, the Joker taunts the two heroes with the knowledge that the cestus gloves were laced with the same rare fever germs plaguing the Sparta Prison inmates. Once the Joker kills the dog, everyone infected will die. Suddenly, Spot bites the Joker. Enraged, the Joker commands his henchman to dispose of the dog. Batman quickly convinces the Joker into believing that Spot's bite carried the fever germs, too, and that the Joker is infected. Sensing a bluff, but not willing to take the risk, the Joker rushes to retrieve the dog. Tied to a rock, Spot is dropped into the river. The Joker leaps in after the dog, forgetting he doesn't know how to swim. Spot keeps the Joker's head above water long enough for Batman to rescue them both. The Sparta Prison populace, along with Batman and Wildcat, all receive inoculations of Spot's anti-bodies, while the Joker is turned over to the proper authorities.
name: May the Best Man Die

description:
Overview

In the over-the-top conclusion to this near-future technothriller miniseries, corporate mercenary Vashnevskaya and his fearsome robotic ally, the "Skorpion 19," finally carry out their long-delayed mission -- a lethal "extraction raid" with an objective that ties into the deepest secrets of Sylia Stingray's mysterious past! The ensuing mechanized mayhem sweeps the Knight Sabers, outnumbered and outgunned, into desperate action against a ravening horde of biomechanical war machines!
name: Bubblegum Crisis

description: Wind. Earth. Fire. Air. Only the Avatar was the master of all four elements. Only he could stop the ruthless Fire Nation from conquering the world. But when the world needed him most, he disappeared. Until now... On the South Pole, a lone Water Tribe village struggles to survive. It's here that a young Waterbender Katara and her warrior brother Sokka rescue a strange boy named Aang from a cavernous iceberg. Not only is Aang an Airbender - a race of people no one has seen in a century - but, they soon discover, Aang is the long lost Avatar. Now it's up to Katara and Sokka to make sure Aang faces his destiny to save the tribe - and himself.
name: Chapter One: The Boy in the Iceberg

description: Ben Templesmith (30 Days of Night, Fell) continues with his new all-eerie and humorous series. The bodies continue to pile up as Wormwood and his oddball entourage continue their investigation into just what has been gestating inside many of the victims and who's behind it. Well, at least they would be if you could get them out of the pub for more than five minutes.
name: Birds, Bees, Blood & Beer Part-2

description:
In this issue Lois Lane makes a deal with Superman. She wants to chase down a story and face the dangers all by herself without Superman's intervention.

  1. "Survival!" written by Roger Stern, penciled by Bob McLeod, inked by Brett Breeding, colored by Glenn Whitmore and lettered by Bill Oakley.
  2. "Ma Kent's Photo Album" written by Roger Stern, penciled by Kerry Gammill, inked by Dennis Janke, colored by Glenn Whitmore and lettered by Bill Oakley.

Notes:

  • Lana Lang, Pete Ross and Lori Lemaris cameo photo appearances.
  • "With special thanks to: -John Byrne, for pulling it all together. -Curt Swan and Wayne Boring, for keeping the faith. -And especially Jerry Siegel & Joe Shuster for giving us a legend."
  • This issue contains 40 pages.
name: Survival! / Ma Kent's Photo Album

description:
Superman is back! But his return raises questions, including the most compelling: What will be the fate of the other Supermen?

Clark Kent is found alive! Superman rescues Clark Kent?!

Notes:

  • Cover sketched by Ed Hannigan, penciled by Kerry Gammill, inked by Jackson Guice and colored by Denis Rodier.
  • First appearance of Doctor David Conner of S.T.A.R. Labs.
  • Superman, Doomsday, Lois Lane and Bibbo appears in the flashback sequence.
  • Triangle 1993 #32.
  • Chronological continuation from Adventures of Superman #505.
  • Chronological continuation in Superman: The Man of Steel #27.
name: And Who, Disguised as Clark Kent?

first_appearance_objects.name: The Mystic Symbol of The Seven

object_credits.name: The Mystic Symbol of The Seven

description:
Hank Pym tries to psychoanalyze Norman Osborn but Norman won't co-operate. He thinks that Nick Fury is after his Oz formula and that's a secret he plans on keeping to himself. He doesn't react well when informed that S.H.I.E.L.D. have seized all of his company assets. 
 
Presenting his findings to Nick Fury and the rest of the Ultimates, Pym also shares with them the information that Dr. Octopus has come forward and is willing to do his part to help out and begin to atone for his past behavior. Fury poses the question to the Ultimates asking if that offer should be accepted as it'll be up to them to clean up the mess if Octopus is leading them on. 
 
The offer is accepted and Dr. Octopus is taken to the lab where he'll be able to help the science team work on formulae to stabilize the genetic manipulation undertaken on himself and the other prisoners. There he is also re-introduced to something he'd been missing since his arrest, his arms. And he's quick to take advantage. The high security cells' power supply is terminated and the prisoners emerge. The power dampening collars also become deactivated. Osborn, Kraven, Electro and the Sandman are free and ready to wreak havoc on the S.H.I.E.L.D. Triskelion's staff.
name: Chapter 2

description: 1. The Books That Couldn't Be Bound (Superman) -- 2. The Ruby With the Magic Curse (Green Arrow) -- 3. Nothing But Money, Money, Money! (Super Sleuth McFooey) -- 4. The Faces of History (Boy Commandos) -- 5. Let Them Eat Bread (Zatara) -- 6. The Second Chance (Batman & Robin)

Fury calls in The Ultimates to respond to the escape of Osborn and his crew from their holding cells. They arrive and Iron Man is unable to detect any life signs. On further searching of the facility they find a badly injured Hank Pym and two other S.H.I.E.L.D. agents, the only survivors of a crew of 38. Osborn and the other prisoners are gone. 
 
Assuming that Osborn will do something crazy, Fury calls in Spider-Man for his own safety and to assist in the recapture of the fugitives. But Norman Osborn is wilier that Fury expects and calls in a favor from his political connections to go over Fury's head.
name: Chapter 3

description:
1. The Mermaid from Metropolis! (Lois Lane, Superman, & guest starring Aquaman & Topo) -- 2. Peg (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 3. The Girl Atlas! (Lois Lane, Lana Lang & Superman) -- 4. Lois Lane Loves Clark Kent! (with Superman)

On cover: Lana: "Here's the Scoop I Promised You, Lois. I've Become As Strong As Superman!"

Lois: "Congratulations, Lana! It Couldn't Happen to a Nicer Girl... Gulp ... (Except Me!)"
name: Lana Lang, Girl Atlas!

description: 1. Droopy -- 2. Droopy -- 3. Wuff the Prairie Dog -- 4. Flip 'n' Dip -- 5. Tom & Jerry -- 6. Barney Bear & Benny Burro -- 7. Bertie Bird (full text) -- 8. Big Spike & Little Tyke

The escapees from S.H.I.E.L.D. custody hole up at Wilson Fisk's place in the Hamptons. Osborn usues his political connections to demand money and amnesty for himself and his group of villains. The President doesn't appreciate it and lets Nick Fury know it. 
 
Fury deploys the Ultimates and has them try to track Osborn down through Kraven the Hunter's production company. He needn't have bothered. Osborn has a plan. And it involves taking out S.H.I.E.L.D's Triskelion headquarters.
name: Chapter 4

description:
1. "The Doctor and His Patient" (a Barney bear and Benny Burro story by Carl Barks)
  2. Our Gang story by Walt Kelly

Note: The first issue to feature the chalkboard with chalked in title on the cover. This will be the format until issue #82 of Tom & Jerry Comics.

May Parker is taken into protective custody by S.H.I.E.L.D. agents. S.H.I.E.L.D.'s HQ, The Triskelion, is still reeling after the attack by Osborn and his group of super-powered escapees. Nick Fury's after a damage report but amongst the damage, the only thing missing is Peter Parker, Spider-Man. 
 
Osborn has plans for Peter. He sees Peter as his own perfect creation and intends to mold Peter in his image into the man he wants Peter to be. He gives Peter no choice. Do as he says or Peter's loved ones will suffer. 
 
Nick Fury has a suspicion of what Osborn intends to do next and deploys the Ultimates to intercept.
name: Chapter 5

description: As the Cartoon Network prepares its second smash season of Justice League, the animated comic-book adventures of the World’s Greatest Super-Heroes continue! In this tale by Josh Siegal, former writer for the cult television series The Upright Citizens Brigade, Superman is taken down in battle and the Martian Manhunter must replace him as a hero to millions. But does the shy, reserved alien have what it takes to inspire all of humanity?
name: Must There Be a Martian Manhunter?

description:
Osborn's Ultimate throw down with Captain America's Ultimates on the White House lawn. Spider-Man stands there in stunned silence. Osborn continues to threaten Spidey's family harm if he doesn't play along. Reluctantly, Spidey attacks Captain America. Cap has a trump up his sleeve, he is able to reassure Spidey that his family is safe in S.H.I.E.L.D. custody, freeing Spidey from Osborns thrall and enabling Spidey turn fight alongside The Ultimates.

The battle is far from won, though. The Ultimates are on the back foot and struggling to deal with the combined powers of Osborn's group. Nick Fury sends in one more ally into the fray who may just be able to stop Osborn's rampage.
name: Chapter 6

description:
Nick Fury captures 5 people who genetically alter their DNA. He takes Doctor Otto Octavius, Kraven The Hunter, The Sandman, Electro, and Norman Osborn. He puts them in a S.H.I.E.L.D headquarters where they have session with Hank Pym. Fury finds it a precaution to take them without them having any rights so that they can reverse their altered DNA so they can have a proper trail, while also doing so governmental stuff. Fury believes that the next war will be a genetics war and that by taking these 5 it will be one step closer for them to solve a problem before it starts. But, everything goes wrong when Octavius decided to help. He claimed that without his arms he is nothing and that before he dies he wants to do some good.

Fury talks to the Ultimates. A team that is headed by Fury and he asks them to decide weather or not Otto should help. He tells them he asked first because if something goes wrong they will have to be the ones to go and stop him. Captain America gets angry and never make a decision and wonders why Nick had continued with his experiments on trying to create the serum that turned Steve Rogers into Captain America: The First Successful Super-Soldier in the first place. But Otto is let out and is near his arms. He is talking saying that he can hear his arms and that it could be a connection. The arms by itself goes through the bodies of the four people he was with and he ends up bailing out the others and takes information from S.H.I.E.L.D.'s computer base.

Since Nick had 38 agents at the site and only 3 of them survived, Nick thought of the only person who they all have in common and knowing that the only person that has battled all of them before Nick Fury went to get Spider-man. A government agent picks Peter up from school and tells that the people he fought has escaped. Aunt May and MJ are being watched by S.H.I.E.L.D and have agents making sure their okay. Meanwhile, Norman calls the Secretary of the White House calling him his old friend since they went to school together and has made demands. The President calls Fury into the White House and tells him that if the problem won't be fix he will arrest Fury for treason. With the Ultimate Six having S.H.I.E.L.D information they was able to break in and they ended up grabbing Peter without his mask on. Norman had told Peter that he had no other choice but to join him and the others or his Aunt May would die.

He goes with them to the White House where the final battle would be. It ends with Harry trying to talk to his dad and telling him to stop what he is doing. Tony attacks Norman and they take Norman away so that they can get his DNA information. Harry says to Peter he will kill them all. Peter ends up back at S.H.I.E.L.D, with Aunt May thinking that he was in another facility and will be brought home. While locked up Kraven and some of the other decided to say that they were under mind control by Doc Ock and Norman.
name: Chapter 7

description: How many times does it take for the time traveling Chronos to save his brother from a fire? What happens when he fractures time from trying him so many times?
name: The Moment

description: The comic based on the hit Cartoon Network series continues as the icy heart of villainy is revealed! You’ll want to grab a sweater and light a fire as Mr. Freeze, Captain Cold, Killer Frost and a chilling cabal of icy super-villains attempt a hostile takeover of a small African nation. Can the League stop them in time or will they be the first victims of the “Cold War?”
name: Cold War!

description:
Overview

In order to get to the bottom of the murders, Wormwood must make the ultimate sacrifice–his own body. Whatever it is gestating inside his withered womb, it's not human. There'll be no happy snaps or cigars at this birth.
name: Birds, Bees, Blood & Beer Part-3

description: Things are spiraling out of control. The plans of the dark forces at work come full circle as Wormwood attempts to use stern language (and a few other things) to stop an ancient world-eating god from treating the city as an appetizer before moving on to the rest of the planet...
name: Birds, Bees, Blood & Beer Part-4

description:
Overview

Wormwood takes his friends out to the local gambling den for Leprechaun fight night. Problem is, they're a little rabid, and if you get bitten, it's next to impossible to find a cure before you die. And not even an immortal like Wormy is immune to their bite...
name: It Only Hurts When I Pee-1

description:
1. Holed Up (Bugs Bunny, Daffy Duck, Rocky and Mugsy) -- 2. Bugs Bunny (Sylvester and Tweety Bird, does not have Bugs Bunny) -- 3. Fast Food (Wile E. Coyote and Roadrunner) -- 4. By Air, Land and Sea (Wile E. Coyote and Roadrunner) -- 5. The Last Laugh (Wile E. Coyote)

"Whatta couple of maroons!"

Time for Wormwood is running out as the Leprechaunni disease takes hold. On safari on the Leprechaun world, as they hunt for their queen, they discover that by killing one and possessing it's head they can create a Leprehaunni translator—the first time in history. And, oh, what secrets they then discover.
name: It Only Hurts When I Pee-2

description:
Hatter Madigan is a solider and royal guard to the Queen on a mission to find the princess Alyss. He finds himself in Paris, France in 1859.He is an expert swordsman but also possesses a favorite weapon in the form of his top hat. Awarded to him on his millinery graduation it unfolds when thrown into a circle of blades and boomerangs back to its owners hand.

Disorientated by the portal travel Hatter arrives in Paris minus his hat. He is immediately chased by the local police. He loses them easily and comes across a park where children fly kites and utters "Redd's Seekers have followed me from wonderland" and he cuts the strings in a flurry of confusion. Elsewhere his hat appears and drops in a puddle before a surprised citizen, who picks up his prize and walks on.

Seeing a figure with a glow around him Hatter follows, assuming the glow is a sign of magic, him into a hat shop which he mistakes of an armory. The man with his hat is surprise when it floats away off his head.

Hatter is set upon by some men who take him for a foreigner, he puts up a valiant fight and kills the men but is soon overpowered by police and taken to jail. At his trial his crimes have become the stuff of gossip and gross exaggeration. He enters the court with a flourish and sends a dagger at the judge before fleeing through a window.

Hatters hat is presented to a mysterious and severe looking man beneath the city streets. He is a magician of sorts who puts a show on at midnight. The show consists of making corpses dance, but tonight they attack the audience and eat them. Hatter sees the magical glow again in an art studio with work by Jules Verne, which he mistakes for Da Vinci and then comes across the magic show. He snatches back his hat and cuts down the zombies with it.

Hatter travels on a train and his hat flies off and lands in a puddle, he walks to it and mutters again theres a puddle where no puddle should be. He steps into the puddle and sinks into a deep watery body of magical water.
name: Where is She?

volume.name: Hatter M: The Looking Glass Wars

description:
Overview

With the Earth laid waste by an assault from microscopic nanites, humanity hides in underground cities. But those cities are being destroyed by the "Gosiodo" - machine beings engineered to convert the remnants of humanity to the will of the nanites. It's up to seven men and women, seemingly immune to the nanotechnology, to fight back... before there's nothing left to fight for.

Matt Fraction and Ben Templesmith continue the story of "Juarez, or 'Lex Nova and the Case of the 400 Dead Mexican Girl ', but turns hilarious and horrifying, in the second issue of IDW's ongoing exploration of the rich fictional universe Steve Niles has created. Niles, teamed with Kody Chamberlin, weighs in with more explosive vampire action of his own in part 2 of "Dead Billy Dead."
name: Dead Billy Dead part 2; Juarez or Lex Nova & The Case of the 400 Dead Mexican Girls part 2:Gods and Other Bosses

description: In Part 3 of Steve Niles and Kody Chamberlain's "Dead Bill Dead," Billy learns that being turned into a vampire is only the beginning of his problems. And Matt Fraction and Ben Templesmith continue "Juarez; or Lex Nova and the Case of the 400 Dead Mexican Girls," their harrowing, horrific story. All in the third issue of IDW's ongoing exploration of Steve Niles's vampire-filled universe.
name: Dead Billy Dead part 3; Juarez or Lex Nova & The Case of the 400 Dead Mexican Girls part 3:Goats Where They Shouldn't Be

description:
Overview

After an epic struggle to bring the Leprechaun Queen back to the mansion, an odious bargain must be struck for her services. Will Wormwood agree to her terms? Will he survive her cure?
name: It Only Hurts When I Pee-3

description: In Niles and Chamberlain's "Dead Billy Dead, Part 4," Billy's relationship, rocky even before he became one of the undead, takes a definite turn for the worse. And in part 4 of "Juarez, or Lex Nova and the Case of the 400 Dead Mexican Girls," Fraction and Templesmith present a freshly dug grave, an exhumed body, more dead goats, a party, a hunt, an intervention, and some actual detective work from Lex.
name: Dead Billy Dead part 4; Juarez or Lex Nova & The Case of the 400 Dead Mexican Girls part 4:Plots

description: In "Dead Billy Dead, Part 6," Billy thought that any cure for his vampirism would be worth the risk involved. But that was before the living autopsy began and he learned that some things were worse than being undead. And in Part 6 of "Juarez," a carefree Bingo has free reign while Lex is locked in the stony lonesome; Echo gives a gift; Joe and Pilar make plans; oh, and Lex's world goes completely to Hell, too.
name: Dead Billy Dead part 6; Juarez or Lex Nova & The Case of the 400 Dead Mexican Girls part 6:Things Get Worse

description: In "Dead Billy Dead, Part 5," Billy learns that being turned into a vampire pales in comparison to the horror he faces as the subject of a living autopsy. And in Part 5 of "Juarez," the town is quiet. Bingo's busy in the basement. Lex gets antsy. A meeting in the middle of nowhere goes bad. Mrs. Acosta speaks. Also, life advice from Lex: how not to kill a vampire and how not to get pulled over.
name: Dead Billy Dead part 5; Juarez or Lex Nova & The Case of the 400 Dead Mexican Girls part 5:Things Get Bad

description: In "Dead Billy Dead, Part 7," the penultimate tale of the ongoing horror show that is Billy's life as a vampire, he attempts to put the literal pieces of his life back together. And in part 7 of "Juarez," you know those stories where all the characters, after struggling long and hard with great adversity both inside and out, have reached the end of their quest and experience a grand reward and are left changed, and better, people for it? This isn't one of those stories.
name: Dead Billy Dead part 7; Juarez or Lex Nova & The Case of the 400 Dead Mexican Girls part 7:The End

description: In "Dead Billy Dead, Part 8," everything Billy has been through so far comes to a particularly nasty conclusion. Although it's not half as bad as what happens to Professor Saxon... meanwhile, in part 8 of "Juarez," Lex Nova looks to wrap up his case, but, as with most things in Lex's life, this wrap-up goes horribly awry.
name: Dead Billy Dead part 8; Juarez or Lex Nova & The Case of the 400 Dead Mexican Girls part 8:Alex Gorodetski & The Case of the 1 Missing White Girl or The Beginning

description: Featuring "The Book Club", "The Hand that Feeds", "Agent Norris: MIA", and "The Trapper". All stories by teve Niles, with art by Ben Templesmith, Syzmon Kudranski, Brandon Hovet, and Josh Medors.

Overview Following the shocking loss of the Icarus, NASA is left scrambling for answers that will appease those in the government trying to shutdown the space program. A second shuttle is launched to investigate the wreckage, but what they discover will put more than just the crew in mortal danger. Sometimes the truth is the last thing we want to find. Series co-creator Steve Niles teams with writer Dan Wickline (Blood-Stained Sword) and artist/painter Milx to bring you the next chapter in this tale of unspeakable horror in the cold hell of space.

Overview The space station has been invaded and the vampires are in control. One by one the humans are being turned into vicious monsters and their time is running out. Can Locke and the handful of remaining crewmembers find a way to warn NASA before Cobb can feast on their blood? And if you're NASA, what do you do with a multi-billion dollar space station full of the undead?

While on the trail of the vampire that turned Commander Cobb, an unarmed Agent Michael Henson is confronted by seven mindless vampires fueled only by their insatiable bloodlust. Meanwhile what should be the happiest day in one couple's life will take a very gruesome turn with a wedding that you will not soon forget.

volume.name: 30 Days of Night: Spreading the Disease

description: Agent Michael Henson follows the clues found in Dinah King's apartment and finds himself at a southern church revival meeting where he is made a horrific offer. How this ties into the death of the Icarus crew begins to unfold. Meanwhile, two girls head out to a late-night rave in the warehouse district only to discover more than just a swinging nightlife.

volume.name: 30 Days of Night: Spreading the Disease

description:
Overview
Reverend Gant and his traveling vampire ministry have vanished into the night and Agent Henson is out of clues and out of time. Just as he's about to pack it in, his mysterious friend informs him of a massacre at a small sports bar in Texas. Is this just a coincidence or the final piece Henson needs to figure out Gant's plan before it's too late?

volume.name: 30 Days of Night: Spreading the Disease

description: The enormity of Gant's plan stands revealed. Accompanied by ex-Navy S.E.A.L.s Gabe and Rafael, Agent Henson must race into a vampire-infested pit of horror if they hope of stopping the demented scheme. Will Reverend Gant and the New Children of God be able to turn the biggest event of the year turn into the biggest bloodbath of all time?

volume.name: 30 Days of Night: Spreading the Disease

description: France, 1942. The Squad searches for the mysterious German device, Codename: Sybil, that can see into the future and does battle with flying commandos and demon soldiers. The boys are forced to make a last stand in a small village that has sold its soul against the Reich's newest weapon, the Wulf Spyder tank.

After interrogating a demon possessed German soldier, the LOST SQUAD finds the location of a secret train depot built by the Nazis. Can they sabotage the mysterious GHOST TRAIN before it disappears with SYBIL on board? And if not, how will they stop the Nazis from winning the war with their clairvoyant machine?

Aboard a runaway train packed with demon soldiers and rigged to explode, the squad comes face-to-face with their nemesis and learn the truth about the SYBIL device. Meanwhile, Sergeant Lymangood battles a threat from the sky - flying commandos equipped with jetpacks!

With the true nature of the SYBIL device revealed, the Squad's battle plans change from search and destroy to a rescue mission. The boys detour to a small Belgian town and receive a hostile reception as their presence draws the full might of the German forces, spearheaded by the dreaded SPYDER tanks, looking for SYBIL.

THE BIG FINALE! Surrounded by spider tanks, demon soldiers and flying commandos, the squad faces a familiar foe and Captain Boudreau must face his worst fear to save the lives of one of his men and a special little girl.

deck: A stranger rode into town. He was only five hands high, had a lengthy snout, a long tail, and was covered with short grey fur. He would one day be known as the greatest warrior the town had ever known.
description: Cerebus rides into a town in the early dawn. Following a skirmish in a tavern he's recruited by a couple of thieves. In exchange for a pouch of gold, Cerebus helps two thieves try to steal the Flame Jewel, whose owner is a powerful wizard.
name: Cerebus the Aardvark

description: Cerebus is captured by marauders, and in order to gain his freedom, challenges their largest warrior. He also finds the Eye of Terim and its guardian, Khem, the dark demon.
name: Captive in Boreala

person_credits.name: Dave Sim
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: Henrot hires Cerebus to defend the honor of his daughter, Red Sophia, by torturing to death a man who has wronged her while Sophia watches. However, when he finally finds his target, Cerebus devises with his own interpretation of Henrot's instructions.
name: Song of Red Sophia

person_credits.name: Dave Sim
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: Cerebus vs Elrod; also Cerebus plays Diamondback.
name: Death's Dark Tread

person_credits.name: Dave Sim
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: Cerebus encounters the Pigts, a barbarian tribe which worships an idol that bears a striking resemblance to the earth-pig born himself. With the Pigts' leader Bran Mak Mufin proclaiming him the incarnation of their God-King, Cerebus must decide whether he will abuse the tribe's beliefs for his own gain.
name: Bran Mak Mufin

person_credits.name: Dave Sim
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description:
1. Note from the Publisher

  2. The Secret!

Cerebus gets in a fight with and beats Turg, who wanted to know what a dying old man told Cerebus earlier. E'Lass, Turg's friend, offers Cerebus a drink. When they go in a tavern, Cerebus sees Jaka and immediately falls in love. Little does Cerebus know, Jaka and E'lass have a history...

  1. The Aardvarkian Age (a map)

  2. Aardvark Comment (letters page, including one by Michael Moorcock, the creator of Elric!)

  3. The Return of Elrod (a pinup / preview of the next issue)
name: The Secret

person_credits.name: Dave Sim
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: On the advice of the dying man from last issue, Cerebus goes to the temple of the Black Sun. Cerebus meets with Elrod again. They journey together, but part again. Elrod runs into Mit, who is a Black Sun follower who made a "Nameless One" costume that looks like Cerebus. Of course Elrod thinks it is Cerebus. Later, the Black Sun followers find out Cerebus and Elrod are in the temple, and Lyran the Death Dealer is ordered to capture and execute them. Will Elrod or Cerebus make it out alive with the treasure?
name: Black Sun Rising : Elrod Again

person_credits.name: Dave Sim
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description:
Because of the wounds gotten from the misadventures in the Temple of the Black Sun, Cerebus becomes delusional. He gets captured by the Conniptins, a nomadic tribe. Because of Cerebus' condition, they don't know what to do with him, except tie him up.

Meanwhile, Captain Turl is scheming against the prince (who he can't kill, lest the wrath of the Prince's father and king Hezzreth befalls him). But Turl releases Cerebus and gives him his sword back so he can kill the three men that supposedly drugged Cerebus, who doesn't know this is merely a test. Cerebus kills the men, thus proving his might, so he is then asked to help the Captain take over Iest.
name: Day of the Earth-Pig

person_credits.name: Dave Sim
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description:
Cerebus leads the Conniptins to take over city of Imesh. When he finally enters the walled city, he sees the citizens are building something large out of stone. Cerebus asks what's going on, but nonoe except a woman named Sedra will give him any answers. She tells him to folow her, but it's a trap, and Cerebus is locked in a prison cell.

K'Cor, the supposed king of Imesh meets his new prisoner. Cerebus finds out the statue is a defense against a secret invasion of the Venusians!

K'Cor gives Cerebus three challenges, the last being to defeat K'Cor himself. After passing the first two challenges, Cerebus fights K'Cor, who soon stops fighting and tells Cerebus he can leave. He also tells Cerebus he poisoned the water around the city and Cerebus' army should be dead by now...
name: Swords Against Imesh

person_credits.name: Dave Sim
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: Cerebus meets up with Red Sophia, who tells him she fought and killed her husband, thus making her available to sleep with. But Cerebus isn't interested in that, just the Black Blossum Lotus mentioned earlier. Also Meirgen joins up. he reveals he owned the lotus for a while. The three watch a caravan, but a guard surprises them by coming up from behind. Sophia asks him to join their group. Cerebus anounces a plan for the four, but later in the night, sneaks off alone.
name: Sophia Returns...!

person_credits.name: Dave Sim
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

person_credits.name: Dave Sim
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

person_credits.name: Dave Sim
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover
